DataElement.preferredName: Therapeutic Procedure Prior VEGFR Tyrosine Kinase Inhibitor Administered Code Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The coded indicator response regarding whether a patient has received prior treatment with VEGFR-TKI.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Therapeutic Procedure Prior VEGFR Tyrosine Kinase Inhibitor Administered
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to whether therapeutic agents (VEGFR-TKI) have been administered in the past.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process.

Concepts.definition: An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter or stop a pathologic process.

Property.preferredName: Prior VEGFR Tyrosine Kinase Inhibitor Administered
Property.preferredDefinition: Earlier in time or order.:A substance that blocks an enzyme needed to form blood vessels.:The act of having given something (e.g., a medication or test).

Concepts.definition: Any substance that inhibits vascular endothelial growth factor receptor, a family of tyrosine kinase receptors involved in the formation of blood vessels.
The act of having given something (e.g., a medication or test).

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

DataElementConcept.origin: CALGB CRF:Cancer and Leukemia Group B Case Report Form
DataElementConcept.changeDescription: For use in CALGB-90802 OPEN registration worksheet - Prior tx

ValueDomain.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Indicator to represent a response of Yes, No, or Not Applicable._The affirmative response to a question or activity._The non-affirmative response to a question._Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context._A system of numbered categories for representation of data.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

Concepts.definition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.:The non-affirmative response to a question.:Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context.:A system of numbered categories for representation of data.:An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.
The non-affirmative response to a question.
Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.
A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.

An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: Created to support Theradex design of CRFs for NCI CCR trials

ReferenceDocuments.name: Has patient had at least one
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient had at least one prior VEGF TKI?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient has renal cell carcinoma, has patient had at least one prior VEGF TKI?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient's disease progressed on one line of VEGFR-targeted therapy (including, but not limited to, sorafenib, sunitinib, vandetanib, pazopanib, or lenvatinib, etc.) as defined by PD per RECIST v1.1 while receiving VEGFR-targeted therapy?
